text: Almost   years free of cancer  but I wish it took me awayMarch     I was diagnosed with Stage  B Hodgkins Lymphoma  I went through   rounds of IV chemo  and on August   I was declared in remission  In three months  I ll be declared officially cancer free  Despite this  I wish the lymphoma killed me During treatment  I began smoking marijuana twice daily to help with nausea and pain  It ended up doing wonders for my depression as well  After I went in remission  I kept smoking  I m now pretty much dependent on it I lost my job  pharmacy technician  two years ago because of a mental breakdown  My coworker was sabotaging my work  deleting phone call records and shredding faxes I had sent and saved  I brought it up to management  who ignored me  and I threatened to kill myself one day in the parking lot  which prompted a hospital visit   About eight months ago  I had another mental breakdown and threatened suicide in front of my wife  who called the police  and I was taken again to the hospital  This time  I was deemed  necessary  and had a  hour stay in a psych facility  I was boarded with drug addicts and patients with psychosis dementia  and I feel I didn t get the help I needed I was assigned outpatient treatment  which I completed  and I never followed up with any of my doctors because I always feel ignored  I haven t been to a therapy session since last October and I haven t had my meds refilled in about two months I ve completely wasted the second chance I was given in life  I m still jobless  basically addicted to marijuana  and aside from my wife  who works  hour weeks to support us  I feel like no one is truly here for me  and even she is starting to break Life is pain anyone that tells you differently is trying to sell you something
summary: In March I was diagnosed with Stage B Hodgkins Lymphoma. I went through rounds of IV chemo and on August I was declared in remission. In three months I'll be declared cancer free. During treatment I began smoking marijuana twice daily to help with nausea and pain. After I went in remission I kept smoking and I'm now dependent on it. I lost my job two years ago because of a mental breakdown. I haven't been to a therapy session since last October and haven't had my meds refilled in about two months.

text: Philisophical question Let s say you re in a dark room  You ve always lived in the dark room  Your biggest fear in life is being stuck in the dark room forever   You find a door   You think that it s highly likely that that door will lead to something scarier than the dark room  Or it could lead to another dark room  Maybe there s nothing behind the door except a wall But maybe the door opens to a corridor  where you can find your way out of this place  But that corridor could also be a dead end Your hope is that the door leads somewhere nice  You won t know until you open the door and see what s beyond   But again  behind the door might be something worse than staying in the dark room There is no other door  If you open this door and find out that there is nothing better than the dark room  then you ll have to live without that hope  the endless possibility of what  could  have been behind the door   Do you open it
summary: A person's biggest fear is being stuck in a dark room forever. If they find a door, they hope it will lead to something better than the dark room. If it doesn't, they will have to live without the hope of what could be behind it.

text: The Chronicles of Tim s Beans So I wrote this in an English class group project with a girl I have a crush on  if you were in that group with me then know one of the   girls in the group I have a crush on   We needed to use some vocab words in a paragraph  initially we wrote an incohesive paragraph with the last sentence saying we d converge them into a coherent storyline but we ran out of budget   my idea as well  Mrs  D wasn t good with that so we adapted it into this bean themed story  which I came up with the initial theme of but everyone else really did a good job of bringing it together Tim s bean company is looking for a new Vice President of the board   Most companies hiring would rather not be affiliated with a high school student that has bad grades   Sarah wanted to expunge all her bad grades so that she would be hired for the job   Passing Mr  Z s  originally was name of our actual physics teacher  I switched it to just last initial here  physics would be a huge attainment for her job application   However  Timothy s finite amount of Baked Beans is running low  which might prevent him from hiring anyone  Sarah wanted to ascertain the whereabouts of her resume but it had disappeared   Sarah holds that one poem she can never remember the name of in high esteem  it s about Tim s baked beans  she hopes   Although Sarah is a very cogent writer  she couldn t convince the company to hire her as she write about corn rather than beans   We had to disperse the acceptance letters before Tim s  ran company ran out of bean workers   The CEO of other bean company A said he would   bequeath all my beans to Timothy so his company doesn t go under   We would converge all out bean factories together  but we ran out of budget I hope you enjoyed this And thanks to u QuaccAttacc  for telling me to post this
summary: Tim's bean company is looking for a new Vice President of the board. Tim has a finite amount of Baked Beans and might not be able to hire anyone. Sarah wanted to expunge all her bad grades so that she would be hired for the job. The CEO of other bean company A will bequeath all his beans to Timothy so his company doesn't go under.
